result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody Rob Kitsemble was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED AND STAYED
If revoked, 33 days credit
If revoked, defendant shall pay court costs as previously ordered.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.
Defendant shall maintain full time employment. If not employed, seek work with at least 5 applications per week. Document applications to DOC.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall submit to random drug testing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody Rob Kitsemble

records.addlTxt: DOC letter re sentence as to Count 1

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cody Rob Kitsemble in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Cody Rob Kitsemble. Per agreement, felony charge amended to misdemeanor possession of THC as a repeater. State recommends one year jail, costs, DNA. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of amended charge. Credit discussed--30 days served as sanction plus 3 days. State heard and agrees with 33 days credit. State heard. Attorney McDougal heard. Mr. Kitsemble heard. Court heard and orders 6 months jail with huber, 33 days credit and court costs, imposed and stayed, 1 year probation with conditions: Defendant shall maintain full time work or seek work with at least 5 applications per week and verify applications; court costs; DNA; random drug testing.

Defendant Cody Rob Kitsemble not in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Cody Rob Kitsemble. Warrant authorized on defendant's failure to appear.
Status conference on May 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Cody Rob Kitsemble in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Cody Rob Kitsemble. Attorney McDougal requests more time due to a new case being filed. Court sets status.
Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on May 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Cody Rob Kitsemble not in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Cody Rob Kitsemble. Attorney McDougal does not think defendant is in custody currently. State requests warrant on defendants nonappearance. Court authorizes warrant.

Defendant Cody Rob Kitsemble appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Lisa A McDougal for Cody Rob Kitsemble appeared in court, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Matthew Small sworn and testified. Cross. Comments heard. Court heard and finds probable cause to bind over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Cody Rob Kitsemble appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charge, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests signature bond. Court orders $1000 signature bond with a condition to contact SPD. Status date set.
Defendant shall contact State Public Defender's Office at 608-401-2030 as soon as possible.
Status conference on February 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
